result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:34 PM Defendant Brian Joseph Hebert in court.  Attorney Ralph David Imholte not in court.  Attorney Lynne Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CM23, 22CM27, 22CM36, and 22CM81.  Atty filed motion to withdraw this morning.  Atty Zimmer states he can take cases.  Def phone 715-292-8865.  Atty calling def this afternoon.  Atty Imholte is discharged from representing in each case.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on October 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:16 AM Defendant Brian Joseph Hebert in court.  Attorney Ralph David Imholte appeared by video for Brian Joseph Hebert.  Attorney Lynn Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CM23, 22cm27, 22cm36, and 22CM81.  22CM81 needs initial appearance and STC in remaining cases.  Atty has not been able to be in contact with def.  Atty and def in break out room.  Back on the record at 11:32.  Atty, 22CM81, recv'd complaint, waive reading pleads NG.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:50 AM 22 CM 23, 22 CM 27, 22 CM 36, 22 CM 81 - Defendant Brian Joseph Hebert appeared by video (fr ACJ).  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin R Kressel appeared by video.  Attorney Ralph David Imholte appeared by video for Brian Joseph Hebert. Warrant cancelled, order vacated each case.  St req cash bail w/same cond's prev set.  Def missed 2 ct dtes in a row.  Ct sets bond in 22 CM 81 - $1500 (!000 is pst'd & needs addt'l $500)....same non $$$ cond's remain in place.  Others cses remain unmodified.  If at liberty, DAP.
Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:23 AM - 22 CM 23, 22 CM 36, 22 CM 27, 22 CM 81 - Prosecuting attorney Lynne K Van Hollen appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian Joseph Hebert not in court.  Attorney Ralph David Imholte appeared by video for Brian Joseph Hebert. Atty has not been able to contact client.  Each case BOW/statewide, forf b/b in each case, send notice w/in 30 days.

1:30 PM - 22 CM 23,  22 CM 81, 22 CM 36, 22 CM 27 - Defendant Brian Joseph Hebert appeared by video (fr ACJ).  Attorney David Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Phy address - homeless, brian.hebert7@gmail.com, 715/292-8865 but phone is missing, not wking. St req $1000/cash in Case 22 CM 81 only.  Ct orders $800/Cash & absol, warrants cancelled in all cases.
Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 11:00 am. Bk on record at 1:45 pm w/Atty Brewer present  & states arrest dte was 7/20 and should have had BH earlier.  ADA does not have any answers to STC of rt to BH.  Ct lets ruling stand as ordered.  Bk on record 2 pm - DA does not req bond chg, NO new bond is any cases.  Told to be bk in Ct Aug 15 at 11 am in person.

11:25 AM Attorney Lynne Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ralph David Imholte in court for Brian Joseph Hebert. Defendant Brian Joseph Hebert not in court.  Cases Attorney unsure of where def is bailed out over the weekend.  State asks warrant and forfeiture of bond.  Warrant authorized, body only, bond forfeited, notice of forfeiture if no response in 30 days judgment will enter.
Email sent to ACJ advising def has court on July 18;  ka
Status conference on July 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:21 PM Prosecuting attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian Joseph Hebert appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ralph David Imholte appeared by video for Brian Joseph Hebert. 
22CM23,22CM27,22CM36 and 22CM81-- Atty is not apt'd on 22CM81-- Atty was not aware of the new arrest. State comments on bail/bond. Atty comments on bail/bond. 
Ct orders-- $1,000 cash, ABSOL
Given right to an atty on new case.
Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on June 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

03:00 PM Attorney Ralph David Imholte in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty comments-- at MMC, asking for STC be adj'd  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
State's Motion for Joinder or in the alternative, Other Acts Evidence
Status conference on June 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

02:27 PM Defendant Brian Joseph Hebert in court with attorney Ralph David Imholte.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  22CM27,22CM36,22CM23--  22cm23 and 27 are schd for a STC, 22CM36 is schd for an INIT. 
22CM36-- rec'd compl, waives reading and pleads NG, noted. No agreement on the older cases, State will most likly file joinder and/or other acts. 
Ct will schd a STC on the three cases, if the State wants Joinder or other acts it needs to be filed by next hearing. State comments on bail/bond. Atty comments on bail/bond
Ct orders-- Current bail on 22CM27 and 22CM23 now also covers this case. Ct comments close call on needing more cash to be posted. Def does not need to post more cash or sign a new bond. 
State will file other acts and or joinder by the end of the month  Status conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
COVERS CASES 22CM23 & New Charges.
Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.
Defendant to have NO CONTACT with M.H. or residence of 317 7th Ave. East, Ashland.
Defendant allowed to go to 317 7th Ave. East one time while supervised by law enforcement to retrieve belongings.
